Author: fishonthesun
Text: Its definitely something you need to be very cautious with- sure, faster cardio is a thing, but that's meant more for the morning after a good nights sleep, to help your body get better at burning fat and switching to fat burning mode so that during extended periods of exercise (like an hour or more or straight exercise) while you have proper nutrition/ calorie levels, your body can switch from carb burning to fat burning more easily, and you wont hit that "wall" or it will be lessened.  I'm not a doctor so I cant tell you if for your situation you are practicing a dangerous behavior. But I will say, if you are underweight, you should stop, and if you feel dizzy, your throat feels tight, or if your heart rate gets much higher than usual or feels jumpy or "skippy", you should stop immediately and get a source of electrolytes (if it's too difficult to get calories, look for powerade zero or Gatorade zero) and if you can handle calories, a fast acting carbohydrate, even half a banana, and then something more dense in protein.  All I am looking for here is a little harm reduction, please stay as safe as you can make yourself do.
